Detailed Description

Management of counters to collect in order to produce statistics

Each process generates an Counters data that correspond to a set of counters (user defined, applications defined...). These Counters are cumulated in order to produce global statistics about the execution. This operation involves an field by field accumulation with various cumulative operators (+, max, min ). A set of userdefined field exist. That could be re-used in order to cumulate order counter.

A counter is typed, the value of a counter may be integer or floating point value. The three ways to collect the value of counter are:

  • By using a function that will be called on notification of the Collection Event and with class derivating from CallbackCollectCounters.
  • By giving the address of a variable that should be used as the counter value.
  • By a direct use of the counter value stored in the counter manager object.
See also:
Net::StatisticsService

Id Util::CounterManager::register_fcounter ( const std::string &  name,
OpCumul  opcumul 
)

Register a new floating point counter The method is used to register an integer counter. The caller should directly set the value of its counter using fupdate method.

Parameters:
name [in] the name of the counter
opcumul [in] the operator used to cumul the counters
Return values:
the counter id of the registered counter
Id Util::CounterManager::register_fcounter ( const std::string &  name,
OpCumul  opcumul,
double *  counter 
)

Register a new floating point counter The method is used to register an integer counter with a fixed address in memory. During the collecting step, the value is recopied into the current counters data structure. The address should remain valid until the counter is unregistered.

Parameters:
name [in] the name of the counter
opcumul [in] the operator used to cumul the counters
counter [inout] the address where to get value
Return values:
the counter id of the registered counter
Id Util::CounterManager::register_fcounter ( const std::string &  name,
OpCumul  opcumul,
void(*)(double &counter, void *)  fnc_collect,
void *  arg 
)

Register a new floating point counter The method is used to register a floating point counter with callback used to collect the value. During the collecting step, the callback 'fnc_collect' is called with the first argument the location where to store the result of the counter. The second argument is used to pass and extra information about the context of the 'fnc_collect' call.

Parameters:
name [in] the name of the counter
opcumul [in] the operator used to cumul the counters
fnc_collect [in] the function called when the collection of counters is required
arg [in] the parameter pass to fnc_collect
Return values:
the counter id of the registered counter

OpCumul  opcumul 
)

The second argument is used to pass and extra information about the context of the 'fnc_collect' call.
